localization.THESIDEBAR.Title: The Sidebar
localization.THESIDEBAR.Description: This Tour will give you an overview of each of the Tabs in the Sidebar
localization.THESIDEBAR.SidebarContent:
The right-hand Sidebar contains a lot of useful tools and is where you'll store Documents like Actors, Items, Scenes, Journal Entries, and a lot more.

It is organized into a set of tabs you can switch between. You can right click a tab to pop it out into a floating window.
localization.THESIDEBAR.ChatLogContent:
The Chat Log stores a history of your messages, whispers, actions, and dice rolls.

You can right click on different kinds of chat cards to see more things you can do with them.
localization.THESIDEBAR.CombatTrackerContent:
The Combat Tracker allows you to track turns for combat or any other turn-based scenario.

You can roll for everyone, just your NPCs, or one at a time. Your players will also be able to roll for themselves.
localization.THESIDEBAR.ScenesContent: The Scenes tab allows you to create and manage scenes, such as battlemaps, theatre of the mind images, and landing pages.
localization.THESIDEBAR.ActorDirectoryContent:
The Actor's directory is where you'll store all of the Actors you need for players or NPCs in your upcoming sessions.

Actors you aren't currently using can be stored in a Compendium Pack to improve load times.
localization.THESIDEBAR.ActionButtonsContent: Most tabs have buttons at the top to create a new Document or Folder for organizing your content.
localization.THESIDEBAR.ItemDirectoryContent:
The Item directory is where you'll create and store anything that you want to give your players or NPCs in upcoming sessions.

Depending on your game system, this includes items, class features, spells, and more.
localization.THESIDEBAR.JournalEntryContent:
The Journal Entries tab is where you'll store important world details, NPC details, quests, and anything else you may want.

You can also create a journal entry for each of your players to use for note taking.
localization.THESIDEBAR.RollableTablesContent:
The Rollable Tables tab is where you'll store tables of random (or semi-random) options that you or your players can roll on, such as loot chances or random encounters.

The tables can contain text, Scenes, Items, and Actors. Each option can be weighted differently to change its likelihood of rolling.
localization.THESIDEBAR.CardStacksContent:
The Cards tab is where you'll store decks, piles, and hands of cards.

You can create a standard 52 deck of cards or a custom deck entirely.
localization.THESIDEBAR.PlaylistsContent:
The Playlists tab is where you'll store collections of music, ambience, and sound effects.

Playlists can be shuffled, played in order, or set up to work as a soundboard. The GM and players can all independently control their volume levels.
localization.THESIDEBAR.CompendiumPacksContent:
The Compendium Packs tab is where you'll setup archives of things like Actors and Items. Many Systems and Content packs will add content here for your use as well.

These documents aren't automatically loaded when players connect which makes them good places to store data you don't need very frequently.
localization.THESIDEBAR.SettingsContent: Finally, the Settings tab has is where you can control game settings, find documentation, and more.
